a fantastic game from the good old days of bio ware runs great playing on the steam deck and it natively supports controllers which is great too  as for the game itself its quite a bit shorter than your average bio ware rpg 25 hours if going for a completionist run but its fun regardless with all the interesting characters and story beats youd usually find as well as some surprises along the way   overall a solid 910

a bit dated but it has great story and companions the moral choices are a high point either to walk the path of the open palm with good and noble decisions or instead to follow the path of the closed fist and embrace an absolutely evil route a pretty classic bioware experience that if you wish for more mass effect or dragon age this is a good option

i absolutely love this game and dearly hope it sees a modern remake its probably too archaic in design for a remaster some day but this version is barely playable and requires pretty extensive modding to function as intended the modding tools are just as ancient as the game is so getting it all to work properly can be a real test of patience  i cant recommend it in its current state and highly doubt theyll ever fix it if its sold on gog i might check it out there instead

1010 game been playing it ever since it released on the og xbox back in the day but  there are a few hoops you gotta go through first you need to copy the steamdll file from your steam install into the game or it will not launch at all second you need to rename the launcher as jadeempirelauncherbackup and the exe file as jadeempirelauncher then you are good to go graphics are a bit dated now but plenty of nexus mods to smooth out the jagged textures and make the cutscenes prettier   rr
